content.question: Which of the following most directly contributed to the continuation of the trade of enslaved peoples from the continent of Africa?

choices.label: Atlantic creoles worked to help Europeans explore territories and set up plantations.
There was demand from Europeans for enslaved people, and African leaders sold war captives from opposing kingdoms.
North African elites formed alliances with Portuguese enslavers to sell soldiers to the Americas.
Wealthy industrialists demanded low-cost labor for their factories in the Americas.

content.answer: There was demand from Europeans for enslaved people, and African leaders sold war captives from opposing kingdoms.

topic.text: 2.3: Capture and the Impact of the Slave Trade on West African Societies
